title: Questor share tip: Galliford Try profits at top end of expectations
text:
1,734.00 -2.000 
The FTSE 250-listed housebuilder and infrastructure construction group is enjoying a strong housing market and growing construction order book, says Questor. 
Galliford Try (LSE: GFRD.L - news ) £17.36+75p Questor says HOLD 
Galliford Try’s [LON:GFRD] shares rose more than 4pc yesterday after it said a good UK housing market and recovering construction outlook will push results to the top end of expectations. 
= More than house building = 
Galliford is not just a house-builder, it also has a large construction business. 
In terms of group revenue, the split is about 40pc from house building to 60pc from infrastructure construction, while the gap is much wider when it comes to profits, with 90pc of operating profits coming from house building and only 10pc from construction. 
= Construction improving = 
The construction sector has suffered over the past four years due to dwindling amounts of work. This has resulted in profit margins falling. 
However, the outlook is now improving, with the order book jumping to £3.5bn at the end of June, from £1.4bn at the same stage last year. 
Clyde Lewis, from broker Peel Hunt, said there are signs profit margins are creeping up, and the order book secures about 90pc of the forecast revenue for the current year. 
= House building still strong = 
The UK housing sector remains strong. The number of home sales increased to 3,180 in the year to the end of June, up from 3,110 in the previous 12 months. The average selling price increased by 7pc to £327,000. 
Gailliford’s future is looking relatively bright, with forward sales of homes at £343m, only down slightly from £348m last year. The land bank available to develop property also increased by 13pc during the year. 
The company’s results are now expected to be at the top end of expectations. 
Mr Lewis upgraded his full-year pre-tax profit forecast by £3m, to £121m, giving 23.7p in earnings per share, from revenue of £2.26bn. 
= Shares (Frankfurt: DI6.F - news ) deliver = 
Galliford’s shares are currently trading on 15 times forecast earnings, falling to 13 times next year. That isn’t cheap for a cyclical house-builder. 
We previously recommended that investors have faith in the economic recovery (Buy, £11.91, January 9, 2014) . That faith has been rewarded with gains of £5.38, or 45pc, per share in less than 18 months. Those gains are good enough for us and we’d take some profits. Hold.
